Submodules¶

modpro.calc module¶

calc.py - simple code to show how to execute testing

modpro.calc.mul(a: float, b: float) → float[source]¶

mul multiples two numbers

Args:

a (float): First number b (float): Second number

Returns:

float: mul of a and b

>>> mul(2,3)
6
modpro.calc.sum(a: float, b: float) → float[source]¶

sum adds two numbers

Args:

a (float): First number b (float): Second number

Returns:

float: sum of a and b

>>> sum(2,3)
5

modpro.timezone module¶

timezone.py is based on Real Python book. It explains how to use time and timezones to stamp events.

modpro.timezone.add_tz(dt: <module 'datetime' from 'C:\\Users\\csell\\Miniconda3\\envs\\py37\\lib\\datetime.py'>, zone: str) → <module 'datetime' from 'C:\\Users\\csell\\Miniconda3\\envs\\py37\\lib\\datetime.py'>[source]¶

add_tz datetime doesnt assign a time zone. This function shows how to do it.

Args:

dt (datetime): original datetime zone (str): desired zone

Returns:

datetime: a new datetime with the zone assigned
